title: Chicken Kiev
requires: Emeril’s Essence  (the recipe is in the Miscellaneous folder).
ingredients: 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, about 6 ounces each
2 eggs, beaten with 1 tablespoon of water
2 cups fine dried bread crumbs (seasoned with Emeril’s Essence)
instructions: Place each chicken breast between 2 sheets of plastic wrap.  Using a meat mallet, pound each breast out very thin.  Remove the top pieces of plastic wrap from each breast and season with salt, pepper and Essence.

Combine the butter, chopped chives, and lemon juice.  Cover the top of each breast with some of the butter mixture then fold the 2 smaller ends of each breast in by 1-inch.  Beginning with the long ends, roll each breast up tightly and secure with toothpicks.

In 3 separate plates or bowls place the flour, the beaten eggs, and the bread crumbs.  Dredge the stuffed chicken in the flour, shake off any excess then dip them in the beaten egg.  Let the excess beaten egg drip off then dredge each rolled breast in the seasoned bread crumbs, coating completely.
Remove the basket from the fryer and add the rolled chicken breast.  Slowly lower the basket into the hot oil and fry until golden brown, about 8 minutes, turning occasionally for overall browning.
Remove the chicken when done and drain on paper towels.  While the chicken is still hot season with Essence.
